revised_title: Geological Overview of the Mineral Basin in South Wales
tldr: This article describes the Mineral Basin in South Wales, a large area containing coal and iron ore deposits. The basin is over 100 miles long and has varying widths across different counties. The author, Edward Martin, discusses the depth and quality of the coal and iron ore strata, as well as the faults and irregularities present in the area. The limestone formations are also mentioned, as they form an underground connection across the basin.
